summary:
Yemen, in West Asia, is a country with a rich history, dating back 7,000 years. It has been home to ancient kingdoms, influenced by various religions, and was once divided between Ottoman and British rule. The modern Republic of Yemen was formed in 1990.

Since 2011, Yemen has faced a political crisis and a brutal civil war, causing a massive humanitarian emergency. The war has involved many groups and foreign powers, leading to severe food shortages and widespread suffering. Today, Yemen is one of the world's least developed and poorest countries, needing urgent aid.
title: Yemen
